videos.title: What Is a Half Note?
videos.description:
Find the print & audio materials for Unit 1 at: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/store/sheet-music/hoffman-method-for-piano-unit-1


In this lesson, you will learn a new rhythm: Half Note. Mr. Hoffman will teach you what it means and how it works. Then working together you can dictate the rhythm of the song "Chocolate." You will also review all rhythms learned so far: Quarter Note, Quarter Rest, Eighth Notes. Happy Playing!

videos.title: All About the Grand Staff | Notes, Names & Piano Tips
videos.description:
Find the print & audio materials for Unit 2 at: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/store/sheet-music/hoffman-method-for-piano-unit-2

In this lesson, you will learn about the Grand Staff. Mr. Hoffman goes over grand staff notes on lines and spaces, high notes and low notes, and how to find and use the guide notes Middle C, Treble G, and Bass F. 

✨Watch this lesson & hundreds more ad-free at https://www.HoffmanAcademy.com/lessons! ✨

The grand staff is a special tool for writing music. You might be interested to know that when it was first invented a thousand years ago, it only had four lines. Today we use a 5-line staff.

🎹 Learn more about the grand staff, and get free blank staff paper, at the Hoffman Academy website: https://hoffmanacademy.com/store/learning-and-teaching-resources/grand-staff-guide

You can also download worksheets from our website that will give you additional practice and review with the grand staff and some experience drawing the clefs and notes on the staff for yourself:
https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/store/browse?searchString=grand%20staff

videos.title: How to Play an A Minor Piano Scale, One Octave
videos.description:
Download our free guide to learn all piano scales: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/piano-scales/

🎹 Learn more about the A minor piano scale, including songs in the key of A minor, at the Hoffman Academy website: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/a-minor-piano-scale/

Today we're learning another one-octave scale in the lovely key of A minor. A minor is the relative minor of C major.

In music, if two different keys are related they share the same key signature. This means they'll both use the exact same sharps or flats as each other.

videos.description:

🎹 Find the complete print & audio materials for Unit 9 at: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/store/sheet-music/hoffman-method-for-piano-unit-9

Today we’re learning how to play the G major one-octave piano scale and arpeggio. First, let’s consider the ladder of fifths to figure out how many sharps we need for the G major piano scale. The key of G major has one sharp and that's an F sharp.

In addition to the G major piano scale, you can find information on playing all major and minor piano scales on the Hoffman Academy website.

videos.title: How to Play Für Elise on Piano | Super Easy Tutorial
videos.description:
🎹 Learn more about Beethoven’s Für Elise, including sheet music for this composition, at the Hoffman Academy website: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/all-about-fur-elise/

✨Watch this lesson & hundreds more ad-free at https://www.HoffmanAcademy.com/lessons! ✨

This video from Hoffman Academy will help you learn how to play Für Elise on the piano. Watch as Joseph Hoffman teaches a simplified, Early Elementary arrangement of Ludwig van Beethoven's timeless classic, Für Elise. 

The great Ludwig van Beethoven composed "Für Elise" a little over 200 years ago in Vienna, Austria, and then dedicated the piece to a mysterious woman named Elise. In German, “für Elise” means “for Elise”.

Who was this woman named Elise? No one knows, but as you listen to "Für Elise" you can get some hints about how Beethoven felt about her. By the end of this video, you will be playing a version of this beloved classical piano piece, which is one of the most famous of all time. 

By the way, this "Für Elise" tutorial you are watching is the super easy preparatory level tutorial, which is perfect for anyone with zero to six months of piano playing experience.

I highly recommend that you get the accompanying sheet music for this tutorial to help you learn how to play Für Elise on piano. This sheet music is available for purchase online at the Hoffman Academy's store.

If you're a Premium Member of Hoffman Academy, then the sheet music is free and included with your Premium Membership.

If you're a more experienced pianist and you'd like harder versions of "Für Elise", you can also check out my level 1, level 4, or level 6 tutorials. 

🎹 All of these tutorials and more information on Ludwig van Beethoven’s "Für Elise" can be found at the Hoffman Academy website.

Let's get to the piano to begin practicing this historic piece. We hope you enjoy the tutorial and that you learn how to play Für Elise on piano with our help.

videos.title: Amazing Grace performed by Joseph Hoffman - Hoffman Academy
videos.description:
Get piano lessons & materials at https://www.HoffmanAcademy.com
Join our Facebook community: https://www.facebook.com/HoffmanAcademy/
Need a piano?  Check out our buying guide: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/choosing-a-piano-or-keyboard-for-the-beginning-student/

Joseph Hoffman performs David R. Naylor's piano solo arrangement of the beloved Christian folk hymn, Amazing Grace.

Lyrics:
Amazing grace! (how sweet the sound)
   That sav'd a wretch like me!
I once was lost, but now am found,
   Was blind, but now I see.

'Twas grace that taught my heart to fear,
   And grace my fears reliev'd;
How precious did that grace appear
   The hour I first believ'd!

Thro' many dangers, toils, and snares,
   I have already come;
'Tis grace hath brought me safe thus far,
   And grace will lead me home.

The Lord has promis'd good to me,
   His word my hope secures;
He will my shield and portion be
   As long as life endures.

Yes, when this flesh and heart shall fail,
   And mortal life shall cease;
I shall possess, within the veil,
   A life of joy and peace.

The earth shall soon dissolve like snow,
   The sun forbear to shine;
But God, who call'd me here below,
   Will be forever mine.

- John Newton, Olney Hymns, 1779

   The hour I first believ'd!

Thro' many dangers, toils, and snares,
   I have already come;
'Tis grace hath brought me safe thus far,
   And grace will lead me home.

The Lord has promis'd good to me,
   His word my hope secures;
He will my shield and portion be
   As long as life endures.

Yes, when this flesh and heart shall fail,
   And mortal life shall cease;
I shall possess, within the veil,
   A life of joy and peace.

The earth shall soon dissolve like snow,
   The sun forbear to shine;
But God, who call'd me here below,
   Will be forever mine.

- John Newton, Olney Hymns, 1779

videos.title: Learn Diatonic Chords & Progressions | Major & Minor
videos.description:
🎹 Find the complete print & audio materials for Unit 10 at: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/store/sheet-music/hoffman-method-for-piano-unit-10

Learn more about diatonic chords at Hoffman Academy: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/diatonic-chords-in-major-and-minor-keys/ 

Today we are going to learn about diatonic chords, and how to build a chord progression.

You are already very familiar with some diatonic chords even though we've never called them by that name. “Diatonic” is just a fancy word that means belonging to a particular key.

For example, let's say we are in the key of C major. The C major scale has the notes C, D, E, F, G, A, B, and C. Each of those is called a pitch, and each of those pitches is diatonic in the key of C.

videos.title: Mission Impossible - Level 6 Piano Repertoire Demo - Hoffman Academy
videos.description:
How Long Does it Take to Learn Piano? https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/h...
A lot of people ask how long it takes to learn to play the piano. Maybe you have a certain song in mind, and you want to know how long before you can play it. Maybe you’re starting lessons and wondering where it ends. Or maybe you want to know how long before you can accompany yourself while you sing, or play with a band, or play hymns in church. The real answer to “How long does it take to learn to play the piano?” is: It depends! Let’s explore the possibilities.

First of all, the amount of time it takes to learn to play the piano depends on what level of playing you want to achieve. A person with no experience can learn to play the melody of a short song in minutes. For instance, if you want to play “Hot Cross Buns” you can watch the first Hoffman Academy lesson and master this simple song right away, without any prior training. On the other hand, let’s say you want to become a world-class classical pianist, and perform crazy-advanced pieces like Rachmaninoff’s Piano Concerto #3. In that case, you’re looking at a minimum of 10 to 15 years of concentrated study with a master teacher, and hours per day of practice.

Most people who want to learn the piano aim for something in between these two extremes. Whatever level you’re hoping to achieve, your progress will most of all depend on how diligently and effectively you practice. Other important factors include your teacher, how motivated you are, and your individual learning pace.

Level 6: Your artistic expression continues to develop. Your fingers are comfortable with frequent wider reaches, and you can play four-note chords. You can learn to play most popular music and movie themes, like the theme from “Mission Impossible."

Get more piano lessons & materials at https://www.HoffmanAcademy.com
Join our Facebook community: https://www.facebook.com/HoffmanAcademy/
Need a piano?  Check out our buying guide: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/choosing-a-piano-or-keyboard-for-the-beginning-student/

videos.title: What is Solfège? - Music Notes - by Hoffman Academy
videos.description:
Learn more about the history & use of Solfège: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/what-is-solfege/

What is Solfège? Hoffman Academy teacher, Stephanie, gives you a quick overview of the music education tool that helps musicians and music students learn pitch, intervals, transposition and more.

Solfège is a great tool for learning music, for sight-reading, and for understanding music theory. It’s been part of the language of music for many centuries. 

Solfège gives us a way to name patterns in music, talk about them, and get to know them. That way when we see them on the page we know how they should sound, and when we hear them in music we know how they’ll look on the page.
tags: do re mi fa so la ti do

videos.title: C Minor Piano Scales & Arpeggios
videos.description:
🎹 Find the complete print & audio materials for Unit 12 at: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/store/sheet-music/hoffman-method-for-piano-unit-12

Download our free guide to learn all piano scales: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/piano-scales/
Learn more about the C minor piano scale, including chords and songs in this key, at the Hoffman Academy website: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/piano-chords-in-c-minor/

In this lesson, we're going to learn how to play a two-octave C minor piano scale and an arpeggio in C minor. 

If you’ve been taking our online piano lessons, you know that C major is our major scale with zero sharps and flats. Can you tell me what minor key also has zero sharps and flats? If you said A minor, you're correct. To find the relative minor, it's always just a skip of a third below.

So A natural minor also has zero sharps and flats just like C major. Now today, we're going to be going up even further on the ladder of fourths. We can use the minor scales just like the major scales to go up fourths and add flats. So if A minor has zero sharps and flats, we can go up a fourth to D.

D minor has one flat. Now if we go up another fourth from D, which note would we be on? So G minor should have two flats. Remember, every time we go up a fourth we add a flat. So we have a B-flat and an E-flat now in G natural minor.

What if we want to go up another fourth? Where would that bring us? What's a fourth above G? If you said C, you're correct, and I'm going to come down to this C, and based on our law of the ladder of fourths how many flats should we now have in C minor? If you said three, you're correct. We're now up to three flats.

Let's take a look at our ladder of fourths. You can see if we're looking on the minor side we went up a fourth from A to D, to G to C, and now that we're in the C minor scale, we have three flats: B-flat, E-flat, and A-flat.

videos.title: Happy Birthday Mozart | Hoffman Academy | Music Notes
videos.description:
🎹 Who was Mozart? Learn all about Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, and many other famous composers, at the Hoffman Academy website: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/who-is-wolfgang-amadeus-mozart/

Today, January 27th, 2019, we celebrate Mozart's 263rd birthday. Mozart is one of the most famous composers that has ever lived. In this video, we get to know Mozart a little better. 

Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart lived in Europe over 250 years ago and is still famous today because he was nothing short of a musical genius. Mozart started playing piano at age three, attempted his first compositions at age four, violin at age five, and was playing organ by age six.

videos.title: Who is Scott Joplin? | Hoffman Academy | Music Notes
videos.description:
🎹 Learn more about piano players, including Scott Joplin, at the Hoffman Academy website: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/who-is-scott-joplin/

Who is Scott Joplin? He's the king of ragtime!

Joplin was an African-American composer and pianist, partially responsible for beginning a new era of music called “ragtime”. His most famous piece, Maple Leaf Rag, was released in 1899 and it was one of the first he published.

Maple Leaf Rag, along with many others, began ragtime. Ragtime was a new style of music with lots of syncopation, or emphasis, on the offbeats. Ragtime music had big energy and was fun to dance to. Ragtime would later spark the beginning of swing music, which evolved into jazz.

videos.description:

videos.title: What Are Intervals in Music?
videos.description:
🎹 Find the materials for this lesson & much more in our Unit 4 piano method book:
https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/store/sheet-music/hoffman-method-for-piano-unit-4

What are intervals in music? An interval is simply a measurement of the distance between two notes. In this lesson, you will learn more about musical intervals, including how to use them while playing the piano. Mr. Hoffman will help you practice identifying intervals on the staff and on the piano. Happy Playing!

Step 2: Look for guide notes when first learning to read sheet music.
Step 3: Identify steps and skips between notes.

Learn how to teach yourself piano with Hoffman Academy's online music lessons for beginners. 

Our first piece of advice would always be to try to find a good piano teacher. If your own self-practice is the gas pedal, a piano teacher would be like the steering wheel. Finding a good piano teacher will help you stay on the right track.

videos.title: 12 Bar Blues - Piano Tips
videos.description:
🎹 Learn more 12 bar blues piano tips at the Hoffman Academy website: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/seven-steps-to-super-sight-reading/

Today we're going to learn how to play a very common form used in jazz called 12 bar blues.

12 bar blues is a kind of tradition in popular music that has been around for over a hundred years. In a nutshell, 12 Bar Blues is a twelve-measure long repeating chord progression that appears literally in hundreds, if not thousands, of popular songs in the genres of blues, jazz, or rock.

It's also used as a form for improvising. Today, we'll explore some ways you can play the 12 bar blues on piano so you can join in this rich musical tradition.

🎹 Find the complete print & audio materials for Unit 12 at: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/store/sheet-music/hoffman-method-for-piano-unit-12

videos.title: Counting Rhythms with Our Rhythm Challenge - Eighth Rests
videos.description:
🎹 Learn more about counting rhythms at the Hoffman Academy website: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/counting-rhythms/

In this lesson, we're learning a new, more advanced method for counting the beat while reading rhythms. This method is called counting a subdivided beat. In music, subdividing a beat means splitting it into equal parts.

Once you know this more advanced method for counting rhythms, you'll be ready to accurately perform even more advanced rhythms.

videos.title: Sonata-allegro Form in Music
videos.description:
🎹 Learn more about musical terms, including form in music, at the Hoffman Academy website: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/a-music-terms-list-for-deeper-understanding/

🎹 Find the complete print & audio materials for Unit 13 at: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/store/sheet-music/hoffman-method-for-piano-unit-13

Today we're going to take a closer look at the form of "Sonatina" in C major. "Sonatina" in C was written using a special form called sonata-allegro form.

Sonata-allegro form was used extensively back in the Classical period, the time of Mozart, Clementi, and Beethoven.

Beethoven's sonatas are some of the greatest piano works ever written. Knowing the sonata-allegro form will help you understand how these sonatas are built.

What is a sonatina? A sonatina is simply a short sonata.  Sonatinas and sonatas both generally have three movements, a fast movement, a slow movement, then a fast movement.

videos.title: Dynamics in Music | Piano Lesson
videos.description:
🎹 Learn more about dynamics in music at the Hoffman Academy website: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/all-about-dynamics/

Today we're learning about dynamics in music. To help understand the power and excitement of dynamics, we're going to be getting lots of help from Mr. Ludwig van Beethoven and his wonderful nine symphonies. For starters, let's listen to some of the second movement of "Beethoven's Ninth Symphony."

Dynamics are the louds and the softs in music, and everything in between. On the softest, quietest end of the spectrum is pianissimo. Pianissimo means very soft. One small notch louder is piano. Piano means soft. Next comes mezzo piano, which means medium soft. If we go a little louder we get to mezzo forte, and then forte. Forte means strong and loud. Finally, we get to fortissimo which means very strong and loud.

You can think of progressing up each dynamic level as if you're going up steps on a staircase, but there's another way you can increase volume more smoothly and gradually using what's called a crescendo. A crescendo means to smoothly and gradually grow louder.

videos.title: Learn the Chromatic Scale
videos.description:
🎹 Find the complete print & audio materials for Unit 13 at: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/store/sheet-music/hoffman-method-for-piano-unit-13

Download our free guide to learn all piano scales: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/piano-scales/

Learn more about the chromatic scale with Hoffman Academy:
https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/the-chromatic-scale-piano-playing-tips-solfege-fingering 

In this piano lesson, we're going to be learning a new kind of scale that is built completely with half steps giving it a unique sound. It's called the chromatic scale.

You probably noticed I was playing every single key. And when we go from one key to the nearest key, we call that moving by half step.

It gives it a very unique sound. Most of the scales we've learned have a combination of whole steps and half steps. The chromatic scale is all half steps.

videos.title: Tempo Indications / Tempo in Music
videos.description:
🎹 Learn more about tempo in music at the Hoffman Academy website: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/what-is-tempo-in-music/

Today we're learning about tempo indications. A tempo indication is a musical term often in Italian, which always appears at the top of your piece telling you how fast or slow to play. A tempo indication can also tell you about the mood of the piece. 

Let's learn more about tempo indications by listening to examples of music from some great composers.

One of the trickiest jobs a composer has is to take all the musical sounds in her or his head and turn them into symbols on a piece of paper that another musician can pick up, and then recreate those sounds the composer originally had in mind.

The first piece we listen to in this video is by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. Mozart wrote the word “andante” at the top of the score to let the performers know to play it at a peaceful relaxed tempo.

Andante means slow, but not too slow. Andante feels relaxed, but it still has movement. Perhaps like a walk along the beach, taking your time, but still going somewhere.

videos.title: Piano Interval Challenge
videos.description:
🎹 Learn more about piano intervals at the Hoffman Academy website: 
https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/what-are-intervals-in-music-theory-piano-intervals-explained/

Today you're going to be taking the piano interval challenge!

Are you ready? Good, let's come to the grand staff.

Before we take the challenge, let's review what an interval is. An interval is the distance between two notes on the staff or on the piano keys.

To measure an interval, we count starting from the first note. In the video, we go from the first note to the second note. So this interval would be a second, and it's the same for the staff. 

Notice that when we're playing the piano interval of a second we're going from a line to a space note. When it's a third, we'll always go from a line to a line, or it's also possible to go from a space to a space to be the interval of a third.

videos.title: Piano Triads - Major & Minor
videos.description:
🎹 Learn more about playing piano triads at the Hoffman Academy website: 
https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/playing-piano-triads-music-theory-in-action/

Today we are learning finger power exercises that will help us review all 12 major and minor triads.

In case you forgot, a triad is just another name for a three-note chord. 'Tri-' as a prefix means “three”. Think triangle, tricycle, or adenosine triphosphate, which your body would definitely be using to ride a tricycle.

So remember, a triad is a group of three notes in a chord. Let's come to the piano and get ready to play some triads. 

Let's consider figuring out a major piano triad. In C major it's easy, right? All white keys: C E G. One way to figure out a triad is just by remembering the pentascale. If I say give me a C major triad, you can use the C major pentascale, and then just skip instead of stepping through the pentascale. That builds the major piano triads.

🎹 Find the complete print & audio materials for Unit 7 at: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/store/sheet-music/hoffman-method-for-piano-unit-7

videos.title: Piano Sight Reading Challenge in 3/4, 2/4, and 5/4
videos.description:
🎹 Find the materials for this lesson in Sight Reading Trainer Book 2:
https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/store/sheet-music/sight-reading-trainer-book-2

🎹 Learn steps for super sight reading at the Hoffman Academy website: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/seven-steps-to-super-sight-reading/

Today we're taking another sight reading challenge!

Every day when you sight read, I'd like you to follow some steps, and you can find these steps in your Sight Reading Trainer Book 2. 

We practice sight reading because it's a super useful skill. As you’re sight reading, try to not just look at the notes and rhythms but also try and incorporate the dynamics too.

If you spend a lot of time practicing sight reading, you will be able to open up almost any piece of music and play it on your first try if it's not too hard. And that's why I encourage you to practice your sight reading skills every day.

videos.title: Hanon Exercises
videos.description:
Learn more about using the Hanon exercises at the Hoffman Academy website: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/the-benefits-of-hanon-exercises-for-piano-players/

🎹 Find the complete print & audio materials for Unit 14 at: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/store/sheet-music/hoffman-method-for-piano-unit-14

In this piano lesson, we revisit a collection of famous finger power exercises by C.L. Hanon. These are finger exercises that I have used for years, ever since I was a child and I highly recommend them as a way to build finger strength and speed. They are also helpful in developing a clear and even tone.

videos.title: How to Read Bass Clef Notes on Staff | Piano Tips | Hoffman Academy
videos.description:
🎹 Learn even more about bass clef notes on staff at the Hoffman Academy website:
https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/how-to-read-bass-clef-notes/

Is reading bass clef notes on staff difficult for you? Mr. Hoffman has some easy tips to help you master sight reading notes in the bass clef for piano playing. 

What is a bass clef? The bass clef is the symbol musicians use whenever they need to write low notes. Cellists and tubaists read bass clef notes, and pianists read bass clef for the notes played by the left hand.

The bass clef isn't just to tell you that the notes will be low. It's specifically placed on the five-line staff to show where the F line is. You see, the bass clef is actually a very old-fashioned way to draw the letter F. 

You could also try remembering a trick I tell my younger students: the bass clef is a frowny face which stands for F. So simply look for the line between the two eyes of mister frowny face and any note on that line is an F. Also, this is not just any F. This F is called “bass F” and it’s the F just below middle C on the piano. From there you can figure out any other note in the bass clef by simply following the musical alphabet. 

If you train yourself to recognize the bass clef guide notes, then you can easily figure out any other note. The good news is that you've already learned your first guide note: bass F.

Happy Practicing!

🎹 Learn more about notes on the bass clef at the Hoffman Academy website.

 #HoffmanAcademy #PianoTutorial #OnlinePianoLessons #BassClef #PianoNotes
tags: how to read bass clef notes

videos.title: How to Create Piano Chord Progressions for Your Compositions
videos.description:
🎹 Learn more about piano chord progressions, including how to read chord symbols, at the Hoffman Academy website:  https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/read-chord-symbols-piano/

Today we're getting started on a composition project featuring piano chord progressions. Becoming a well-rounded musician means not just learning how to play music by other composers, but learning how to compose original music for yourself. 

Every composition needs some starting point. Back in Unit 1, our starting point was a rhythm that you composed first and then we added a melody on top of that. In other composition projects, we started with a mood that we wanted to create and then built it out from there. Today’s starting point is going to be a piano chord progression.

videos.title: Counting Rhythms with our Rhythm Review | Hoffman Academy | Piano Lesson 149
videos.description:
🎹 Learn more about counting rhythms at the Hoffman Academy website:
https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/counting-rhythms/

In this lesson, you will review the relationship between rhythm and beat. Mr. Hoffman will also review the relative values and durations of all notes and rests learned in prior lessons. Afterward, you can take the rhythm challenge! 

This video is all about rhythm and beat. It's important to understand the difference and relationship between beat and rhythm.

In music, the beat is steady. Rhythms, on the other hand, can have different patterns of faster or slower sounds in various combinations. Let's review some of the rhythms we've learned and how many beats they are worth. 

#HoffmanAcademy #PianoTutorial #OnlinePianoLessons #CountingRhythms

videos.title: How to Play "We Don't Talk About Bruno" on Piano | Easy Tutorial
videos.description:
🎹 Find the sheet music and learn more about this hit song at the Hoffman Academy website: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/we-dont-talk-about-bruno-easy-piano-tutorial/

Discover how to play "We Don't Talk About Bruno'' on piano. This hit song is from Disney's Encanto and was composed by Lin-Manuel Miranda. 

This is not Lin-Manuel Miranda’s first time composing music for Disney films. In fact, he wrote songs for Disney’s Moana while he was writing his hit musical “Hamilton”. Encanto is Miranda’s latest animated musical with Disney, and he says he never expected “We Don’t Talk About Bruno” to be such a huge success.

Lin-Manuel Miranda’s children were the first ones to notice the catchiness of this tune. They overheard him composing it at home and were always singing it around the house. Miranda had to tell them they weren’t allowed to sing it at school until after the movie was released. Now, everyone is singing it!

🎹 Learning how to play “We Don’t Talk About Bruno” on piano

To begin playing this popular song on the piano, let's first find our position. Our right hand is going to have finger 1 here on middle C, so go ahead and find this on your piano.

By the way, the notes taught in this piano tutorial are in the same key as the original version so you can even play along with the movie soundtrack using these exact notes, and it should sound great.

This video tutorial for how to play “We Don’t Talk About Bruno” on piano includes short excerpts from the longer song. You’ll be learning the parts that are the most fun and easiest to play on the piano. You can then combine these short excerpts while playing with the original track.

videos.title: Practicing B Minor Piano Scales, Arpeggios & Chords
videos.description:
Download our free guide to learn all piano scales: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/piano-scales/

🎹 Learn more about the B minor piano scale, including relatives and other minor scales at the Hoffman Academy website: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/b-minor-piano-scale/

In this lesson, Mr. Hoffman will review the two octave B minor piano scales, arpeggios, and & diatonic chords, as well as provide fingering advice, practice tips, and diagrams. 

Starting with the B minor piano scale

To figure out our key signature for B minor we can use the ladder of fifths. Remember, for major keys we start with C major and then go up fifths. Every time we go up a fifth we add a sharp. 

This is the same for the minor ladder of fifths, but the minor ladder of fifths begins on A minor with zero sharps. If we go up a fifth to E minor we get one sharp. Then we go up another fifth to B minor.

In B minor we have two sharps, which are F sharp and C sharp. What is the relative major of B minor? A relative key means the same key signature, so the relative major of B minor is D major because they both have the same key signature, including both F sharp and C sharp.

🎹 Watch the video above to begin playing the B minor piano scale with both hands. You can also learn more about the B minor scale, including some songs in the key of B minor, at our website.

Happy Playing!

videos.title: How to Play Moonlight Sonata by Beethoven | Sheet Music & Piano Tutorial
videos.description:
🎹 Get “Moonlight Sonata” sheet music at the Hoffman Academy website: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/store/sheet-music/moonlight-sonata-1st-movement-early-intermediate

This video is an early intermediate-level piano tutorial for Beethoven's famous "Moonlight Sonata", first movement.

Ready for more? Try out late intermediate tutorial on the entire first movement of Beethoven's iconic piece here: https://app.hoffmanacademy.com/lessons/piano/moonlight-sonata-1st-movement-full-original-version-by-beethoven/video/

✨Watch this lesson & hundreds more ad-free at https://www.HoffmanAcademy.com/lessons! ✨

Did you know that "Moonlight Sonata" is not what Beethoven called this piece? When he wrote it, he just called it Sonata Opus 27 Number Two. However, a music critic in the audience during one of his first performances heard it and said that it sounded like moonlight on a lake. When this critic published their article, people thought “Moonlight Sonata" and that became its nickname.

Learn more about the song on our blog! https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/blog/all-about-moonlight-sonata

videos.title: Welcome to Hoffman Academy | Learn How to Play Piano | Online Piano Lessons for Kids & Beginners
videos.description:
One of the biggest obstacles to learning piano at a young age is that although lots of kids love music, they tend to hate piano lessons. Fortunately, the problem is simply the old-fashioned way the piano is taught and not the piano itself.

Hi, I'm Joseph Hoffman. Through two decades of research, experimenting, and lots of real-life testing with hundreds of students, I developed a new method for teaching piano that works.
The Hoffman Method taps into a child's natural curiosity and uses experience and exploration to develop complete fluency and musical skills. We see this method inspire students to reach their full musical potential every day. 

Sadly, so many people can't afford private piano lessons. That’s why I decided to use my method to create a series of online piano lessons. We have over 350 video lessons so far, with more being added often.

Experience hundreds of piano lessons that are carefully designed by a trained professional pianist and teacher. Anyone anywhere can learn to play the piano with our fun lessons. Sign up for an account today at https://www.HoffmanAcademy.com/.

 #HoffmanAcademy #PianoTutorials #OnlinePianoLessons
tags: learn how to play the piano

videos.title: Learn Piano Faster with Premium Membership | Hoffman Academy
videos.description:
Part of our mission at Hoffman Academy is to make music education accessible to all. That's why I will never charge for any of our video lessons. 

I'm often asked, “If you provide free piano lessons, then why do you also offer a paid Premium membership?” The answer is in the experience.

Have you dreamed of playing all kinds of music with ease, or writing your own songs? Maybe you'd love the ability to sight-read any piece of music. The truth is this level of musicianship requires more than video lessons alone.

Premium membership provides a deeper exploration of music, and all the tools and instruction you need to learn piano faster are included. 

With guided practice sessions featuring professionally-recorded play-along tracks, sheet music to accompany all of the pieces you're learning, interactive games to keep your skills sharp, and a library of resources to encourage and reinforce your learning, Hoffman Academy Premium has it all. 

Join the thousands of students learning piano and becoming true musicians. Try Hoffman Academy Premium today: https://www.hoffmanacademy.com/premium/

videos.title: Piano Parent Tip #3:🎹🧸
videos.description:
Use positive reinforcement! For every corrective comment, provide at least five positive ones to keep the practice environment encouraging and supportive. Try saying, “Maybe let’s try slowing down a little this time,” instead of, “SLOW DOWN! You’re playing so sloppy!”

How do you use positive reinforcement with your piano students? Let us know in the comments!

#PianoParentTips #MusicEducation #PositiveReinforcement #PracticeMakesPerfect #MusicApps #ParentingGoals #MomGoals #DadGoals #GenerationAlpha #MillennialParents #LearnMusic #TeachMusic #Homeschool #Piano #PianoPractice #KidsPiano #HomeschoolCurriculum

videos.title: Piano Parent Tip #4: 🎶✨ Keep piano practice fun & engaging!
videos.description:
Transform practice time into playtime! Use games like 'Play Your Age' or 'Win One, Lose One' to keep your young musician excited and engaged. It’s not just practice, it’s play that educates!

Discover these games and more engaging strategies in our “How to Help Your Child Enjoy and Succeed at Piano Lessons” guide - 🔗 in bio.

videos.title: How to Buy a Piano: Prioritize Quality
videos.description:
🎹 Piano Purchasing Tip: Prioritize Quality

When buying a piano, prioritize quality to ensure a positive learning experience and long-term use. Choose an instrument that sounds great and is reliable. A well-made piano can make all the difference in your musical journey by keeping you motivated and reducing the need for frequent repairs.

You don't need to break the bank; keep an eye on platforms like Facebook Marketplace for quality pianos at a great price. Be patient and wait for the right opportunity.

For more tips on choosing the perfect piano, check out our blog at HoffmanAcademy.com. 🎹✨

videos.title: 🎹 Piano Purchasing Tip: Looking for your first piano? Don't break the bank!
videos.description:
Used pianos can be hidden gems. Check Facebook Marketplace, Craigslist, or ask around. Many people have unused pianos they'd love to pass on to a beginner — maybe even for free! Factor in moving and tuning costs. These can add up, but you're still saving big.

Pro tip: Bring a piano tuner or teacher to inspect. Watch for cracks, worn hammers, or missing keys. A well-maintained used piano can sound amazing without the hefty price tag. 

Be cautious and avoid scams. Always inspect in person!

Visit HoffmanAcademy.com for more tips and to start our FREE online lessons today! 🎵

videos.title: What is a perfect 4th in piano?
videos.description:
🎵 What's so 'perfect' about Perfect 4ths? 🤔

They're the secret sauce in iconic themes like Star Wars! 🌟

The term "perfect" in music theory doesn't mean "better" or "flawless." Instead, it refers to intervals with a historically stable and consonant sound.

A Perfect 4th = 2 whole steps + 1 half step on the piano. It's the 'Here Comes the Bride' sound! 👰

Learn more about intervals and other music theory concepts at HoffmanAcademy.com. There, you'll find blogs, video games, worksheets, and more—all in our signature friendly, approachable, fun, and colorful style! 🎹✨

Just like many Hoffman Academy students, even Chopin was once experimenting with new ideas. 🌟

Want to hear the full performance? Join our Hoffman Academy Parents, Students, and Teachers Facebook group for the complete video!

videos.title: Voicing - Moonlight Sonata Tutorial Excerpt
videos.description:
Voicing is the key to making the melody truly sing!

🎶 In his tutorial for the first movement of Beethoven's 'Moonlight Sonata,' Mr. Hoffman students through mastering the art of voicing—a crucial technique where you play some notes softly while letting others stand out. This balance is what makes the melody soar above the accompaniment, giving the piece its emotional depth and expressiveness.

🌟 Learn how to make each note play its perfect role in this late-intermediate piano tutorial.

#PianoTips #Voicing #MoonlightSonata #PianoLesson #AdvancedPiano #LearnPiano #STEAMEducation #Beethoven

videos.title: Taylor Swift "Love Story" - Piano Lesson Excerpt
videos.description:
Swifties young and old, get ready to celebrate Taylor Swift’s birthday with a special revisit of her iconic song, "Love Story" in D major! Whether you've loved her since her Fearless era or are new to her music, this 2008 hit continues to captivate hearts across generations. 🎹✨

As we saw during the Eras Tour, this song has incredible staying power. Parents and children alike sang and danced to this "Fearless" era tune in stadiums worldwide, while others even got engaged to its magical melody. 🌟 Now, bring the sparkle of the Eras Tour to your living room as your Swiftie learns to play it at home with Mr. Hoffman's signature teaching style. 🎶

Originally released over the summer, this tutorial is making a reappearance to mark Taylor’s special day. Find the full tutorial on our website and celebrate Taylor's big day by bringing a little "Love Story" magic to your family's piano time! 🎂💖

#TaylorSwift #LoveStory #PianoTutorial #HoffmanAcademy #HappyBirthdayTaylor #ErasTour #LearnPiano #Piano

videos.title: Fun Piano Practice Games
videos.description:
We know practice routines can get disrupted during holiday travel and festivities - but keeping those piano skills sharp can be fun! Our engaging games make it easy to maintain progress even during busy times:

🎵 Mystery Melodies: Train your ear while solving musical puzzles
🚂 Rhythm Train: Build rhythms car by car
🛹 Rhythm Shredder: Keep Rae skating with perfect timing
🐛 Staff Crawler: Help Iggy the Inchworm find lunch while mastering note reading
🏗️ Alphabet Towers: Stack letters to build your theory knowledge
🛣️ Piano Street: Find your way around the keyboard

Just 10-15 minutes of gameplay can help maintain those important skills during the holiday break! 

Premium members, log in to play now! Not Premium yet? Sign up at HoffmanAcademy.com! ⭐

#pianopractice #musicgames #pianoteacher #musicaleducation #pianostudent #musiceducation #hoffmanacademy #pianoapp

videos.title: What is a piano Scherzo?
videos.description:
Ever heard of a piano "Scherzo"? It’s not just a fun word to say—it means “joke” in Italian! Join Mr. Hoffman in this lively intermediate tutorial where we break down the Scherzo from Piano Sonata No. 9 by the one-and-only Franz Joseph Haydn. Known for his playful musical pranks, Haydn’s Scherzo will have you smiling while mastering rhythm, harmony, and technique! 🎶

✨ Did you know? We’ve got three tutorials on this piece, taking you from “What’s a Scherzo?” all the way to playing it with form and artistry. Head to HoffmanAcademy.com to watch the full lesson series from Unit 17 & download the sheet music. Let’s make practice feel like play! 🥳

#HoffmanAcademy #LearnPiano #PianoTutorial #ClassicalMusic #Haydn

videos.title: Happy New Year - Auld Lang Syne Sheet Music
videos.description:
🎉 Happy New Year from all of us at Hoffman Academy! 🎶

As we step into 2025, let’s take a moment to celebrate the friendships and memories that made 2024 special. What better way to welcome the new year than with Auld Lang Syne, a song that reminds us of the connections we hold dear?

Looking for a meaningful way to mark the occasion? 🎹 We’ve got sheet music for Auld Lang Syne available in our store, with versions for both early elementary and early intermediate players. Choose the one that’s perfect for you and start playing this timeless melody today! ✨

videos.title: Chopin's Lost Waltz - Sheet Music
videos.description:
Is learning a piece of musical history on your New Year’s resolution list? 🎹✨ Step back nearly 200 years and play Chopin’s ‘Lost Waltz,’ a newly rediscovered gem from the 1830s. With its striking mood shifts and playful yet melancholic melody, this piece offers a rare glimpse into Chopin’s early creative process. 🕰️

🎶 Watch Mr. Hoffman perform this captivating waltz right here, then grab the sheet music to play it yourself! It’s free for Premium Members or just $3.99. Find it in the Hoffman Academy store & let your fingers dance through history!

#LostWaltz #ChopinRediscovered #PianoLovers #HoffmanAcademy #ClassicalMusic #LearnPiano

videos.title: What is a diminished 5th in piano?
videos.description:
🎵 Did you know the diminished fifth was once called "the devil in music"? 😈 Start with a perfect fifth and lower the top note by a half step to create this once-forbidden interval!

Watch our full lesson on diminished AND augmented fifths in Unit 17 to discover how these "wicked stepsisters" of the perfect fifth create tension and drama in music! ✨🎹

#pianolessons #learnpiano #pianoteacher #hoffmanacademy #musiceducation #musictheory #pianopractice

videos.title: Hoffman Academy - Goodbye to 2024!
videos.description:
Looking back at 2024 with gratitude! 💫

We packed the year with exciting releases: new levels of our rhythm video games🎵, The One Book of All Piano Scales 📚, and fresh tutorials from Taylor Swift to Moana.

Unit 17 brought advanced techniques, complex rhythms, and beautiful works by Haydn and Grieg 🎹. Our library grew with tons of new sheet music arrangements, while our blog explored topics from Clara Schumann to music theory fundamentals.

We created colorful new worksheets and our back-to-school collection (hello, Dynamic Bus and Piano Note Pencils! ✏️). Summer piano camps brought musical adventure to students worldwide 🏕️, Monkey helped Santa navigate his sleigh in our holiday finger puppet shows 🐒🎅, and we even published our first printed books!

The best part? We're just getting started. Coming soon: our new student dashboard and "Sea Turtle Shuffle" game that promise to make learning piano more fun than ever! 🐢

Head to our blog to explore everything from 2024. Thank you to every student, parent, and teacher in our musical community - you inspire us every day to keep creating, innovating, and making piano education accessible to all. ✨

#HoffmanAcademy #PianoLessons #MusicEducation #Bestof2024 #2024SeasonComestoanEnd #LearnPiano #Piano #OnlinePianoLessons

videos.title: Sea Turtle Shuffle - Piano Learning Video Game
videos.description:
Our newest video game is now live! 🐢 In Sea Turtle Shuffle, students help baby sea turtles reach the ocean by playing correct notes on the staff. Start with simple guide notes like Middle C, then level up to tackle more challenging sight reading as notes are added systematically. With a fun speed round at the end of each game, students have a great time while learning to sight read quickly & confidently.

Find this and our other interactive music games at hoffmanacademy.com/games! Available for Premium members. 🌊 🎹

#PianoGames #LearnPiano #TeachPiano #Homeschool #PianoTeacher #HoffmanAcademy

videos.description:
📚 Now in print! Our Sight Reading Trainer Book 1 is available on Amazon at a special launch price of just $5.95 for a limited time!

This comprehensive workbook features 149 progressive exercises with step-by-step instructions for effective practice. The exercises begin with basic "Repeats, Steps & Skips" and gradually advance to full Grand Staff reading and intervallic pattern recognition.

Throughout the book, Mr. Hoffman and friends guide students through each new concept. Each exercise includes clear fingering guidance and checkboxes to track your progress.

Printed on cream paper for comfortable reading - get your physical copy at this special launch price before it increases!

https://a.co/d/1YV48mh

videos.description:
How sweet it is!🎶 This young musician just finished Unit 1 and put her skills to the test at a local bakery’s “Play to Pay Day.” Instead of bringing a keyboard, she played Hot Cross Buns on a metallophone—what a fun way to explore transposing! No black keys? No problem!

Moments like these show how music connects us in the sweetest ways. Keep up the great playing!

#HoffmanAcademy #LearnPiano #HotCrossBuns #MusicFun #PianoKids #EarlyMusicEducation

videos.title: March in D Major on Piano
videos.description:
🎶✨ Step back in time with this stately and spirited March in D Major by Carl Philipp Emanuel Bach! 🎹 This lively piece is part of the Anna Magdalena Bach Notebook, a collection of music compiled for J.S. Bach’s wife, Anna Magdalena. With its driving rhythm, playful syncopations, and crisp articulation, it’s a perfect example of C.P.E. Bach’s unique style, bridging the Baroque and Classical eras.​

Want to learn it yourself? Our 3-part lesson series starts with the trickier B section first to build confidence before moving on to the rest of the piece. Master everything from tricky trills to expressive phrasing and bring this march to life! 🏆

Find the full lesson series in Unit 17 on our website! 🔗🎼​

https://app.hoffmanacademy.com/lessons/piano/march-in-d-major-by-cpe-bach-bwv-anh-122-b-section/video/

#HoffmanAcademy #LearnPiano #MarchInDMajor #CPEBach #PianoLessons #BaroqueMusic #ClassicalMusic #PianoPractice

videos.title: La Primavera Piano Tutorial
videos.description:
🌸 Spring is here! Celebrate the season with "La Primavera" (aka "Spring") by Vivaldi, a lively and energetic piece that captures the joy of new beginnings. 🎶 Our super easy tutorial makes it fun for early elementary pianists to play this classic!

Find the lesson at HoffmanAcademy.com/lessons, and check out the Hoffman Academy store for a variety of free & premium springtime resources—including fun worksheets and four more FREE arrangements of "La Primavera" for more advanced students.

videos.title: She learned piano online!
videos.description: Jana has been learning piano online with us for years now, and we find her so inspiring! She has always had such a calm, steady, and accurate way of playing. Great job on this!

videos.title: Her first year of piano lessons!
videos.description: A steady beat and no missed notes from Zosia! This is a song she's learned in her first year of piano lessons with us! We also want to note that while this family wanted to get a real piano, they decided to begin with what they have, and we think that's wonderful. We do recommend a piano with weighted keys, but if that's not accessible to you right away, something is always better than nothing! Great job, Zosia :)⁠
